meanings.definition: The act of condescending or behaving in a patronizing manner towards others.
meanings.sent1: Her constant condescendences towards her classmates made them feel small.
meanings.sent2: His condescendences towards the new employees were evident in his tone.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's condescendences were so exaggerated that they seemed like a comedy sketch.
meanings.sent4: The condescendences of the queen towards her subjects were like a dark cloud over the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her condescendences lingered in the minds of all who witnessed them.

meanings.definition: An instance of showing superiority or arrogance towards someone perceived as inferior.
meanings.sent1: The condescendences of the popular kids towards the nerds were hurtful.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his condescendences whenever he spoke about his achievements.
meanings.sent3: His condescendences were so over-the-top that they became the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The condescendences of the wealthy towards the poor were like a gaping abyss between them.
meanings.sent5: The impact of his condescendences left a lasting mark on those who witnessed them.

meanings.sent1: Her condescendences were evident in the way she spoke down to others.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide his condescendences even when trying to be polite.
meanings.sent3: The condescendences of the celebrity were met with eye rolls from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The condescendences of the politician towards the public were like a slap in the face.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with tension due to her condescendences towards the staff.
